meanings.definition: Encourage or stir up (violent or unlawful behavior)
meanings.sent1: The angry mob was incited by the false rumors.
meanings.sent2: The protest turned violent after someone tried to incite the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to incite the dog to chase its tail.
meanings.sent4: His inflammatory speech incited chaos in the normally peaceful town.
meanings.sent5: The inciting words of the rebel leader fueled the rebellion.

meanings.sent1: The bully would often incite others to pick on the new student.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk was meant to incite the team to victory.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to incite the birds to join in its antics.
meanings.sent4: Her bold actions incited a wave of bravery in her friends.
meanings.sent5: The motivational speaker's words incited hope in the hearts of the audience.

meanings.sent1: The teacher's praise was enough to incite the student to work harder.
meanings.sent2: The smell of freshly baked cookies incited a feeling of warmth and comfort.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to incite the older dog to play with it.
meanings.sent4: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop incited a sense of awe in the hikers.
meanings.sent5: The inspiring music incited a sense of joy in the listeners.
